title: CTI distorts statements of U.S. Commerce Secretary: credit of 2.5 million Moderna vaccines belongs to TSMC

What‚Äôs Up Last Week?

According to IORG‚Äôs database, the most popular topic of last week was, still, the pandemic. Cluster infections in Huan-nan Market (Áí∞ÂçóÂ∏ÇÂ†¥) and Hu-lin Street (ËôéÊûóË°ó) in Taipei City have attracted the most public attention.

Among the suspicious narratives, many are, still, related to vaccines. Chinese state media initiated information manipulation, questioning the DPP ‚Äúwhether it is epidemic control or murder‚Äù by giving Taiwanese people ‚Äúproblematic‚Äù AZ vaccines from Japan. ‚ÄúVoice of Strait‚Äù (Êµ∑Â≥°‰πãÂ£∞) and ‚ÄúHuanqiu Net‚Äù (ÁéØÁêÉÁΩë) linked the fact that the AZ vaccines donated by Japan to Taiwan has not been listed on the WHO EUL (Emergency Use Listing) with terms like ‚Äúdeaths after vaccination‚Äù and ‚Äúhuman experiment.‚Äù ‚ÄúTaihai Net‚Äù (Âè∞Êµ∑ÁΩë) combined the aforementioned elements in an article titled ‚ÄúThe Taiwanese authority has admitted that AZ vaccines donated by Japan to Taiwan is problematic.‚Äù This is an improper use of causality, an ‚Äúinference manipulation.‚Äù Manipulated information disseminated by Chinese state media has entered LINE and Facebook. According to IORG‚Äôs database, there are 65 related posts between June 28th and July 4th.

There was also a suspicious narrative regarding the 2.5 million doses of Moderna vaccines the U.S. donated to Taiwan. In a YouTube video, CTI claimed, distorting statements made by the U.S. Secretary of Commerce, that ‚ÄúThe U.S. Commerce Secretary has confirmed that the U.S. decided to donate such an amount of vaccines to Taiwan because TSMC personally approached the Americans. The credit of this donation should not go to Tsai Ing-wen at all.‚Äù However, according to Reuters‚Äô report of their interview with the Commerce Secretary, she has only mentioned that ‚ÄúThe chief executive of TSMC had asked for help getting access to COVID-19 vaccines.‚Äù There was no mention of the causality between the TSMC‚Äôs request and the American vaccines donation. This is not the first time CTI distorted original content in its reporting. In our last Weekly, CTI distorted a CNN video, spreading manipulated information that ‚ÄúMedigen vaccine production is like a home factory.‚Äù

In addition, IORG has found, again, that Facebook page ‚ÄúSisy‚Äôs World News‚Äù cited a false source in one of its posts. In a post published on July 1st, ‚ÄúSisy‚Äù wrote ‚ÄúChinese leader Xi Jinping has demonstrated his confidence...‚Äù and cited the New York Times (cn.nytimes.com) as the source. However, the report from the Times does not contain the same text. This is the third occurrence of ‚Äúsource manipulation‚Äù by ‚ÄúSisy.‚Äù The previous two occurrences were ‚ÄúMasquerading content origin of Chinese state media as U.S. media‚Äù (R.1) and ‚ÄúOmitting content origin while including content from Chinese state media‚Äù (DA.1).

As Taiwan and the U.S. resumed TIFA talks on June 30th after 5 years, IORG expects related suspicious narratives to appear in the near future, such as TIFA talks will ‚Äúallow ractopamine pork to enter schools‚Äù, ‚Äúallow imports of agricultural products with residual pesticide‚Äù or ‚Äúincreasing American drug price.‚Äù IORG calls on the public to stay alert and be aware of information without sufficient evidence.

Full version of this Dokidoki Alert Weekly is available in Taiwanese Mandarin. Please visit https://iorg.tw/da/5 for more‚Ä¶
